title: Weather and Climate Systems

vocab.definition: The day-to-day conditions of the atmosphere including temperature and precipitation
The average weather patterns in a place over many years
The layer of gases that surrounds Earth
Water that falls from clouds as rain, snow, sleet, or hail
The weight of air pressing down on Earth's surface

teachingNotes: Distinguish between weather and climate. Use local examples and weather maps. Discuss how the sun drives weather patterns.

sample.question: What is the difference between weather and climate?
